channel.title: Haltian IoT Gateway N8 on Haltian Developer Documentation
channel.description: Recent content in Haltian IoT Gateway N8 on Haltian Developer Documentation

item.title: Installation
item.description:
Physical Installation

Mounting Options

The Gateway N8 supports multiple mounting configurations for different deployment scenarios.

Wall Mounting

  1. Mark Mounting Points

    • Use mounting holes on rear panel as template
    • Spacing: 100mm horizontal, 60mm vertical
    • Ensure surface can support 500g load

  2. Install Mounting Screws

    • Use M4 screws (not included)
    • Drill pilot holes for drywall/wood installations
    • Leave 2-3mm gap for mounting slots

  3. Secure Gateway

    • Align mounting slots with screw heads
    • Slide gateway down to lock in place
    • Verify secure mounting before cable connection

DIN Rail Mounting

  1. Install Optional DIN Rail Bracket

item.title: Configuration
item.description:
Overview

The Gateway N8 can be configured for various network topologies and operational parameters. Configuration is performed through the Haltian IoT Studio web interface or via local access methods.

Network Configuration

Ethernet Configuration

DHCP Mode (Default):

The gateway obtains IP address automatically from DHCP server:

  1. Connect Ethernet cable to network
  2. Gateway requests IP via DHCP
  3. Verifies connectivity to Haltian cloud
  4. Registers with assigned IP address

Static IP Configuration:

For networks without DHCP or requiring fixed addresses:

item.title: Operation
item.description:
Normal Operation

Startup Sequence

Gateway boot process typically takes 30-60 seconds:

  1. Power On (0-5 seconds)

    • Power LED illuminates
    • Hardware initialization
    • Self-test procedures

  2. Network Initialization (5-15 seconds)

    • Network interfaces activate
    • DHCP request (if configured)
    • NTP synchronization

  3. Cloud Connection (15-30 seconds)

    • TLS connection establishment
    • Authentication and registration
    • Certificate validation

  4. Wirepas Mesh Start (30-45 seconds)

    • BLE radio initialization
    • Network scanning
    • Sink role activation

  5. Operational (45-60 seconds)

    • Ready to route sensor data
    • LED indicates normal status
    • All services running

Operational States

State Description LED Indicator Action Required
Normal All systems operational Solid Green None
Network Activity Data transmission active Blinking Green None
Warning Minor issue detected Blinking Amber Review logs
Error Service failure Solid Red Troubleshoot
Critical System failure Blinking Red Contact support
Firmware Update Update in progress Blinking Blue Wait for completion

Network Management

Wirepas Mesh Network

Network Formation:

item.title: Specifications
item.description:
Hardware Specifications

Processor

Component Specification
Main CPU NXP i.MX 8M Nano Arm Cortex A53
Architecture ARM 64-bit
Cores Single core
Clock Speed 1500 MHz
Co-processor Arm Cortex M7 @650MHz
Use Case Low-power operations, real-time tasks

Memory & Storage

Component Specification
RAM 1GB DDR4
Storage 8GB eMMC
Expandable Storage MicroSD card slot (up to 128GB)
Boot Storage eMMC (primary), MicroSD (fallback)

I/O Interfaces

Interface Specification Notes
USB 2.0 1 port Type-A connector
Ethernet 1 x RJ45 10/100/1000 Mbps Gigabit capable
BLE 5.0 1 x nRF52833 SDR Wirepas compatible
Expansion Header 1 internal connector GPIO, UART, I2C
Console Port Internal UART Debug and configuration

Wireless Connectivity

WiFi and Bluetooth

Feature Specification
WiFi Standards 802.11 a/b/g/n/ac
WiFi Frequencies 2.4 GHz and 5 GHz
WiFi Security WPA2-PSK, WPA3-PSK, WPA2-Enterprise
Bluetooth Bluetooth 5.0
Bluetooth Range Up to 100m line-of-sight

Wirepas Mesh (BLE 5.0)

Feature Specification
Radio Chipset Nordic nRF52833
Frequency 2.4 GHz ISM band
Channels 0-39 (40 channels)
Sensitivity -95 dBm
TX Power Up to +8 dBm
Range 5-25m indoor, up to 100m LoS
Max Sensors 200-500 (depending on message rate)

Cellular (LTE Version Only)

Feature Specification
Technology LTE Cat 4 with 3G/2G fallback
LTE Bands Region-specific, see regional specs
3G Bands UMTS/HSPA+
2G Bands GSM/GPRS/EDGE
SIM Micro SIM (3FF)
Antenna External SMA connector
Max Download 150 Mbps (LTE Cat 4)
Max Upload 50 Mbps (LTE Cat 4)

LTE Frequency Bands (Example - Verify for region):

item.title: Troubleshooting
item.description:
Quick Diagnostic Checklist

Before detailed troubleshooting, verify these basics:

  • Power LED illuminated (power connected and working)
  • Network cable connected securely (Ethernet deployments)
  • Gateway appears in Haltian IoT Studio (cloud connected)
  • Firmware version is current (check for updates)
  • No recent configuration changes (review change log)

Power Issues

Gateway Won’t Power On

Symptom: No LEDs illuminate when power is connected.

Possible Causes and Solutions:

  1. No Power to Gateway
